name: Drift King Shutokou Battle '94: Tsuchiya Keiichi & Bandou Masaaki
overview: A racing game with stock cars and multiple modes. The game strongly emphasizes manual gear shifting, requiring that the player switch up and down gears with the trigger buttons to increase or decrease speeds. The game features the real-life "Drift King" Keichii Tsuchiya and is based on illegal street racing down Tokyo's Shuto Expressway. Drift King Shutokou Battle '94 is the first of many Shutokou Battle racing games. Future entries would be localized for the US (as Tokyo Xtreme Racer) and Europe (as Tokyo Highway Challenge).
